config.ok_zoomer.title: Ok Zoomer Config
config.ok_zoomer.cinematic_camera.toolti:
Defines the cinematic camera while zooming.
"Off" disables the cinematic camera.
"Vanilla" uses Vanilla's cinematic camera.
"Multiplied" is a multiplied variant of "Vanilla".
config.ok_zoomer.reduce_sensitivity.tool: Reduces the mouse sensitivity when zooming.
config.ok_zoomer.zoom_transition.tooltip:
Adds transitions between zooms.
"Off" disables transitions.
"Smooth" replicates Vanilla's dynamic FOV.
"Linear" removes the smoothness.
config.ok_zoomer.zoom_mode.tooltip:
The behavior of the zoom key.
"Hold" needs the zoom key to be hold.
"Toggle" has the zoom key toggle the zoom.
"Persistent" makes the zoom permanent.
config.ok_zoomer.zoom_scrolling.tooltip: Allows to increase or decrease zoom by scrolling.
config.ok_zoomer.extra_key_binds.tooltip:
Adds zoom manipulation keys along with the zoom key.
A restart will be required in order to apply the changes.
config.ok_zoomer.spyglass_dependency.too:
Determines how the zoom will depend on the spyglass.
"Require Item" will make zooming require a spyglass.
"Replace Zoom" will replace spyglass's zoom with Ok Zoomer's zoom.
"Both" will apply both options at the same time.
The "Require Item" option is configurable through the ok_zoomer:zoom_dependencies item tag.
config.ok_zoomer.zoom_overlay.tooltip:
Adds an overlay in the screen during zoom.
"Vignette" uses a vignette as the overlay.
"Spyglass" uses the spyglass overlay with the vignette texture.
The vignette texture can be found at: assets/ok_zoomer/textures/misc/zoom_overlay.png
config.ok_zoomer.category.values.tooltip: Contains precise configuration of the zoom.
config.ok_zoomer.zoom_divisor.tooltip: The divisor applied to the FOV's zoom multiplier.
config.ok_zoomer.minimum_zoom_divisor.to: The minimum value that you can scroll down.
config.ok_zoomer.maximum_zoom_divisor.to: The maximum value that you can scroll up.
config.ok_zoomer.upper_scroll_steps.tool:
The number of steps between the zoom divisor and the maximum zoom divisor.
Used by zoom scrolling.
config.ok_zoomer.lower_scroll_steps.tool:
The number of steps between the zoom divisor and the minimum zoom divisor.
Used by zoom scrolling.
config.ok_zoomer.smooth_multiplier.toolt: The multiplier used for smooth transitions.
config.ok_zoomer.cinematic_multiplier.to: The multiplier used for the multiplied cinematic camera.
config.ok_zoomer.minimum_linear_step.too: The minimum value which the linear transition step can reach.
config.ok_zoomer.maximum_linear_step.too: The maximum value which the linear transition step can reach.
config.ok_zoomer.category.tweaks.tooltip: Contains options that are unlikely to be changed from the defaults.
config.ok_zoomer.reset_zoom_with_mouse.t: Allows for resetting the zoom with the middle mouse button.
config.ok_zoomer.forget_zoom_divisor.too: If enabled, the current zoom divisor is forgotten once zooming is done.
If pressed, then the "Save Toolbar Activator" keybind will be unbound if there's a conflict with the zoom key.
config.ok_zoomer.use_spyglass_texture.to: If enabled, the spyglass overlay texture is used instead of Ok Zoomer's overlay texture.
config.ok_zoomer.use_spyglass_sounds.too: If enabled, the zoom will use spyglass sounds on zooming in and out.
config.ok_zoomer.show_restriction_toasts: Shows toasts when the server imposes a restriction.
config.ok_zoomer.print_owo_on_start.tool: Prints a random owo in the console when the game starts.
config.ok_zoomer.hide_zoom_overlay.toolt: Hides the zoom overlay while the HUD's hidden.
config.ok_zoomer.widget.bounded_double.b: The value is below the allowed range! The minimum is %s!
config.ok_zoomer.widget.bounded_double.a: The value is above the allowed range! The maximum is %s!
config.ok_zoomer.widget.bounded_int.belo: The value is below the allowed range! The minimum is %s!
config.ok_zoomer.widget.bounded_int.abov: The value is above the allowed range! The maximum is %s!
config.ok_zoomer.category.reset.tooltip: Contains a way to reset this mod's settings
config.ok_zoomer.preset.tooltip:
The preconfiguration which will be used after a reset.
"Default" resets to the default settings.
"Classic" makes the mod imitate OptiFine's zoom.
"Persistent" is based on the "Persistent" zoom mode.
"Spyglass" emulates the spyglass zoom.
config.ok_zoomer.reset_settings.tooltip: Resets the settings to the preset.
command.ok_zoomer.title: Ok Zoomer Information
command.ok_zoomer.restrictions.tooltip: Shows all restrictions imposed on the mod.
command.ok_zoomer.restrictions.acknowled: This server has imposed the following restrictions:
command.ok_zoomer.restrictions.force_zoo: The zoom divisor has been locked to %s
command.ok_zoomer.restrictions.force_spy: This zoom replaces the spyglass' zoom
This zoom requires a spyglass but also replaces its zoom
The spyglass overlay has been enabled
command.ok_zoomer.restrictions.no_restri: This server allows this mod, and therefore, hasn't imposed any restrictions
This server didn't impose any restrictions
toast.ok_zoomer.title: Ok Zoomer
toast.ok_zoomer.acknowledge_mod: The mod is allowed by this server
toast.ok_zoomer.acknowledge_mod_restrict:
This server restricts the mod
See /ok_zoomer for more
platform_migration_warning.title: Platform Migration Warning
platform_migration_warning.explainer: With the beta release of the Quilt toolchain, several mods are already beginning to migrate from Fabric to Quilt, which makes it incompatible with Fabric. It looks like you have attempted to install one of those mods. The following mods were detected:
platform_migration_warning.explainer2: You can either remove these mods, or migrate your modded installation to Quilt, a process in which a great majority of Fabric mods should still work. But before you make a decision, here are the testimonials of the authors of the Quilt mods you have installed:
platform_migration_warning.ennuil.author: Ennui Langeweile
platform_migration_warning.ennuil.testim:
Hello! I've been part of the Modded Minecraft community for quite a few years, and even before then, I've always been playing with mods as a kid.

Watching all the new innovations that those people always keep creating has always fun to me! To tinker with new mechanics to simply causing havoc on Creative Mode, modding has always been quite magic to me, and being able to be one of those magic people meant that I could finally contribute to improving this experience not just for players, but for everyone in general.

However, unfortunately the past year hasn't been great. I have witnessed fellow modders being hurt by those who were meant to protect the community, I have witnessed innovation being drowned by those meant to promote it, I have witnessed a downward spiral going on and on until everything hit the rock bottom, with myself having migraines just from seeing everything falling apart. I felt like I couldn't support that place anymore, and I felt like if there's no way forward, I'd might as well retire from modding, except that I don't want to retire, I still believe that there's more to do!

Thankfully, the Quilt community has popped up as the answer to where to go: A place that can really be called a community for everyone, a place where innovation is encouraged, and a place in which I could call home. If not for it, I don't believe that I would have continued to develop my mods.

On my own mods, especially Ok Zoomer, I've already began to use its innovations, its better decompiler, its mappings, its ergonomic and new API, but with the beta release of the Quilt toolchain, I can finally complete this switch to Quilt. While it's still its first days, I've always loved experimenting with new things! If I didn't, I wouldn't have created Ok Zoomer with a young and new Fabric on the first place!

The Quilt toolchain is still a beta, with many things still being worked on, but together, we'll explore this new horizon of modding, and with it, the expanded opportunities out there.
